metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35513 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw incorrect umask during file or directory modification in the Linux kernel NFS (network file system) functionality was found in the way user create and delete object using NFSv4.2 or newer if both simultaneously accessing the NFS by the other process that is not using new NFSv4.2. A user with access to the NFS could use this flaw to starve the resources causing denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-snapdragon - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1010-aws - 4.15.0-1010.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-23.25').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1010.10').
